text: <@U05Q2R4ESCA> could you help out here? hope I'm doing something wrong here
Hey Hesom - I will take a look at this today and see what is going on :slightly_smiling_face:

The issue seems to be with decoding the `after` token. It seems like a space may be getting passed in on the request which is breaking the decoding. Could you make sure that the `after` value you are providing does not have any additional and unintentional whitespace being added to it prior to sending the request?
i'm taking the string "link" that is returned from the API call itself
is there anything I need to do to modify it?

<@U05Q2R4ESCA> do you know when Release 2 will happen?

```Release 2: Will include the ability to create and delete lists and will be available in the 4th quarter of this year.  There will be a subsequent changelog post when it is available.```
